content:
• Monday, September 17, 2012
  • AMD

    AMD is now down 9.7% AH on news of CFO Thomas Seifert's resignation. The selloff comes even...

    AMD is now down 9.7% AH on news of CFO Thomas Seifert's resignation. The selloff comes even though AMD insists Seifert's departure wasn't due to any disagreement over the company's books. It could reflect a lack of confidence in CEO Rory Read, whose first year at the company hasn't gone swimmingly. "Thomas leaving is a big deal. He was pretty well-liked by investors. He was viewed as the rock throughout all the changes, says Evercore's Patrick Wang.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:27 PM | 3 Comments

  • LDK Solar (LDK -3.2%) made new lows following its bleak Q2 report (ed: LDK definitely took its...

    LDK Solar (LDK -3.2%) made new lows following its bleak Q2 report (ed: LDK definitely took its time to file), in spite of earnings call comments in which the struggling, debt-burdened polysilicon/solar module maker said it was seeking "strategic equity investors," and that two companies "have shown significant interest" in a deal. LDK's Q3 guidance - LDK expects revenue of $220M-$260M vs. a consensus of $453.6M - is one reason for investors to remain cautious.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:04 PM
  • FWONA

    Liberty Media (LMCA) moves a step closer to full control after it converts around 6.25M shares...

    Liberty Media (LMCA) moves a step closer to full control after it converts around 6.25M shares of Sirius XM (NASDAQ:SIRI) B-1 preferred stock, giving it 49.5% stake in SIRI. LMCA +1.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM | 3 Comments
  • HNI

    HNI Corp. (NYSE:HNI) -3.4% AH after lowering its Q3 sales and earnings outlook; the maker of...

    HNI Corp. (NYSE:HNI) -3.4% AH after lowering its Q3 sales and earnings outlook; the maker of office furntiure sees Q3 EPS of $0.55 vs. previous guidance of $0.65-$0.70 and a 7%-10% rise in sales vs. 11%-14% prior. HNI says order patterns in both the supplies-driven and contract businesses have slowed due to broader macroeconomic concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • OCZ

    OCZ has resumed trading. Shares are down 8.5% to $4.08 in response to news of CEO Ryan...

    OCZ has resumed trading. Shares are down 8.5% to $4.08 in response to news of CEO Ryan Peterson's resignation, and within striking distance of their 52-week low of $3.90. STEC and other rivals could benefit from OCZ's management turmoil.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 4 Comments
  • WOR

    Worthington (NYSE:WOR) acquires Westerman Companies, a manufacturer of tanks and pressure...

    Worthington (NYSE:WOR) acquires Westerman Companies, a manufacturer of tanks and pressure vessels for the oil and gas, nuclear and marine markets, for $70M. Approximately $6M of the purchase price was applied to pay down Westerman debt. Shares -2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • ROSG-OLD

    Rosetta Genomics (NASDAQ:ROSG-OLD) jumped +17% today after it announced plans to issue a...

    Rosetta Genomics (NASDAQ:ROSG-OLD) jumped +17% today after it announced plans to issue a business update via conference call on October 2, just days ahead of its annual meeting scheduled for October 5. ROSG-OLD has been on fire as of late, shooting up 56% over the past 30 days and 130% year-to-date.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • MATN

    OXiGENE (OXGN) and the FDA reach a deal on a special protocol assessment for the Phase 3 trial...

    OXiGENE (OXGN) and the FDA reach a deal on a special protocol assessment for the Phase 3 trial of its thyriod cancer drug zybrestat. Shares +14.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • AMD

    AMD CFO Thomas Seifert is resigning to "pursue other opportunities." Corporate controller...

    AMD CFO Thomas Seifert is resigning to "pursue other opportunities." Corporate controller Devinder Kumar will serve as interim CFO until a full-time replacement is found. Seifert's departure is the latest in a series of executive losses for AMD this year. Shares -3.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) announces CEO Ryan Peterson has resigned, and that chief marketing...

    OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) announces CEO Ryan Peterson has resigned, and that chief marketing officer Alex Mei will serve as interim CEO until a permanent replacement is found. Peterson's resignation comes in the midst of a rough year for both OCZ's bottom line and stock price. Shares are halted. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 2 Comments

  • Teradyne (TER -4.7%) ends the day with decent losses after Pac Crest's Weston Twigg predicts the...

    Teradyne (TER -4.7%) ends the day with decent losses after Pac Crest's Weston Twigg predicts the market for chip testing equipment will be roughly flat in 2012, or at the low end of Teradyne's guidance. That leads Twigg to slash his 2012 EPS forecast for the company from $1.93 to $1.60, well below a $1.81 consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • JAZZ

    Shares of Jazz Pharmaceuticals' (JAZZ +15%) jump on a favorable Markman ruling defining the...

    Shares of Jazz Pharmaceuticals' (JAZZ +15%) jump on a favorable Markman ruling defining the patent claim terms related to its narcolepsy medication Xyrem. Jefferies analyst Corey Davis says upon first read, the patent construction ruling "seems like a clear win for Jazz."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • ADY

    Feihe International (ADY -5.9%) shares swoon, attributed to a Seeking Alpha blog offering...

    Feihe International (ADY -5.9%) shares swoon, attributed to a Seeking Alpha blog offering "900,000 reasons to sell," representing the volume of consumer complaints and lawsuits around the Chinese producer of dairy products. Years of "asymmetric information" has allowed ADY "to mislead U.S. investors while its tainted products are heavily denounced by Chinese consumer groups," the article says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • VMC

    Vulcan Materials (VMC -6.3%) shares slip, erasing some of last week's gains from optimism that...

    Vulcan Materials (VMC -6.3%) shares slip, erasing some of last week's gains from optimism that Martin Marietta's (MLM -3.5%) stalled bid for the rival construction materials company could restart following the expiration of a four-month injunction. Without definitive news, the deal is "an open question," a SunTrust analyst says; it’s "a long time to be engaged in a hostile bid."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • RHE

    AdCare Health Systems (ADK -5.2%) trades lower after filing to sell up to 2.61M shares for...

    AdCare Health Systems (ADK -5.2%) trades lower after filing to sell up to 2.61M shares for Cantone Asset Management LLC and other company insiders.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • MCO

    Moody's (MCO +1.7%) is raised to Buy from Hold with a higher $51 price target at Benchmark,...

    Moody's (MCO +1.7%) is raised to Buy from Hold with a higher $51 price target at Benchmark, which says U.S. debt issuance has recovered strongly in recent weeks and should remain strong in upcoming months and well into 2013, helped by comparisons with last year's weak H2.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • CIEN

    Ciena (CIEN -2.6%) falls after Raymond James' Simon Leopold throws cold water on the Street's...

    Ciena (CIEN -2.6%) falls after Raymond James' Simon Leopold throws cold water on the Street's excitement over the company's growing 100G optical transmission gear sales. 100G still only makes up 6% of Ciena's sales, Leopold notes, and while that number will grow next year thanks to design wins, it will bring with it a margin hit. Ciena fell last month after warning of "slower-than-expected rollouts" for new design wins.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • HMRZF

    A profit warning from Swedish clothing seller Hennes & Mauritz (OTCPK:HMRZF, OTCPK:HNNMY)...

    A profit warning from Swedish clothing seller Hennes & Mauritz (OTCPK:HMRZF, OTCPK:HNNMY) appears to have crossed the pond to taint select retail names in the U.S. Foreign exchange headaches and unseasonably warm weather contributed to a 4% decline in H&M's same-store sales after analysts had called for a gain, raising some questions on the sector only a week after Burberry's own warning rattled luxury names. Feeling the heat: NWY -2.7%, CBK -2.2%, OTCQB:BODY -1.6%, OTC:BONT -1.8%, SKS -2.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • DFS

    Discover Financial Services (DFS -1.4%) slips as Stifel Nicolaus reduces its rating to Hold on...

    Discover Financial Services (DFS -1.4%) slips as Stifel Nicolaus reduces its rating to Hold on valuation after the stock hit its price target of $39 late last week. Stifel thinks the stock will have a tougher time justifying another target price raise given the questionable macro environment.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • VLO

    Shares of Valero Energy (VLO -3.6%) slide after Citigroup cut its rating to Neutral on valuation...

    Shares of Valero Energy (VLO -3.6%) slide after Citigroup cut its rating to Neutral on valuation after the shares hit a new 52-week high of $34.35 last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • AMN

    AMN Healthcare Services (AHS -12.3%) takes a hit from a downgrade to Sell by UBS, citing the...

    AMN Healthcare Services (AHS -12.3%) takes a hit from a downgrade to Sell by UBS, citing the recent run up in share price on on the back of its strong first-half results. The firm says that patient volumes and the overall unemployment rate aren't likely to improve materially over the near term, therefore, margins could be at risk.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • AVD

    American Vanguard (AVD +6.1%) gains after announcing the appointment of Jerome Cohen as a member...

    American Vanguard (AVD +6.1%) gains after announcing the appointment of Jerome Cohen as a member of the board, filling the vacancy that had been created by the passing of the late John Miles in February. The board also boosted its semi-annual cash dividend by $0.02 to $0.07 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • MPC

    Marathon Petroleum (MPC -3.4%) slides after Citigroup cut the shares to Neutral on valuation...

    Marathon Petroleum (MPC -3.4%) slides after Citigroup cut the shares to Neutral on valuation earlier this morning. The stock's been a solid performer this year, having charged 52% higher just since mid-June.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • CBIO

    Shares of Targacept (TRGT -11%) take a hit today after the drug developer says that Phase II...

    Shares of Targacept (TRGT -11%) take a hit today after the drug developer says that Phase II trials of TC-5619 - for the treatment of inattentive-predominant attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder - did not meet their primary endpoint. Quixotically, the trial results showed patients on a placebo consistently improved more than patients on TC-5619.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • GILD

    Gilead Sciences (GILD +4.7%) is one of the best performers in the S&P 500 today after...

    Gilead Sciences (GILD +4.7%) is one of the best performers in the S&P 500 today after JPMorgan analyst Geoff Meacham came out with some positive comments about the company's new HIV medication Stribild and hepatitis C drug program, and raised his price target to $75 from $70.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • AIXXF

    Veeco (VECO -3.7%) slides after Piper lowers its estimates and makes cautious remarks, albeit...

    Veeco (VECO -3.7%) slides after Piper lowers its estimates and makes cautious remarks, albeit while reiterating an Overweight. Though believing LED equipment bookings have bottomed, the firm notes management hasn't yet received "concrete signs" of major pickup in demand. Nonetheless, Piper thinks Veeco and Aixtron (AIXG) will maintain an equipment duopoly, and that 2013 will represent "the beginning of a multi-year upcycle in LED lighting." (UBS)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • LTRE

    Learning Tree (OTC:LTRE) announces that it received a buyout offer from CEO David Collins and...

    Learning Tree (OTC:LTRE) announces that it received a buyout offer from CEO David Collins and interested parties at $5.25 a share. A letter to the board proposes a two-step merger. Shares of LTRE have raced 20.8% higher to hit $5.13.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • GSM

    Globe Specialty Metals (GSM -6.8%), a producer of silicon metal and other silicon-based alloys,...

    Globe Specialty Metals (GSM -6.8%), a producer of silicon metal and other silicon-based alloys, is cut to Neutral at B. Riley based on valuation, although the firm continues to like the long-term story. The firm says silicon metal prices remain lackluster, and estimates "would need to come down" if silicon metal prices don't improve in time to be reflected in contracts.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • VVUS

    Vivus (VVUS +1.3%) moves up today after quietly disclosing in an 8-K with the SEC disclosing...

    Vivus (VVUS +1.3%) moves up today after quietly disclosing in an 8-K with the SEC disclosing that its weight-loss drug Qsymia was available in the U.S. market. The announcement was also made on its website, Qsymia.com. Peer competitor Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA +1%) also gets a lift on the news, in spite of the fact that its weight-loss drug, Belviq, won't be available until 2013.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM | 7 Comments

  • Chipotle (CMG +3.6%) gets a little momentum going its way after channel checks from ITG Research...

    Chipotle (CMG +3.6%) gets a little momentum going its way after channel checks from ITG Research reveal that Q3 same-store sales are tracking in a brisk 5.5%-7.5% range. The company is seeking to beat back a challenge from Taco Bell's newly-styled Cantina Bell menu and improve its customer turnaround time in order keep its growth story fully in play.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • GPOR

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR +3.3%) is upgraded to Buy at Global Hunter, with its target price raised...

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR +3.3%) is upgraded to Buy at Global Hunter, with its target price raised to $43 from $30, based on a step-up in the firm's expectations for GPOR's overall operating condition and Utica prospects. The firm also cuts ratings for Dril-Quip (DRQ -0.4%) and Atwood Oceanics (ATW -0.3%) after the recent run-up in their shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • NFLX

    Macquarie adds to Netflix (NFLX -5.4%) slide this morning after initiating coverage with a tepid...

    Macquarie adds to Netflix (NFLX -5.4%) slide this morning after initiating coverage with a tepid underperform rating and a downside price target of $50, nearly 17% off current levels. The firm says that increasing content costs and greater competition are continuing to wick away at its bottom line.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • NWSA

    News Corp. (NWSA +1%) says its chairman and chief executive of Fox Filmed Entertainment, Tom...

    News Corp. (NWSA +1%) says its chairman and chief executive of Fox Filmed Entertainment, Tom Rothman, is going to step down at year-end. Jim Gianopulos, Chairman and CEO of Twentieth Century Fox Film, will takeover the duties as head of the film unit.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM

  • Plantronics (PLT -4%) slips on a downgrade to Neutral from Mizuho. The headset maker, which...

    Plantronics (PLT -4%) slips on a downgrade to Neutral from Mizuho. The headset maker, which sports a moderate valuation but is dogged by growth concerns, had rallied more than 20% from its spring lows.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM

  • Shares of Deckers Outdoor (DECK -4.2%) trade lower after Sterne Agee analyst Sam Poser warns...

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (DECK -4.2%) trade lower after Sterne Agee analyst Sam Poser warns that channel checks show sales of Ugg sales are off to a sluggish start to the season. If the fashion boots don't keep their fad status, Oxen Group notes that making the bull case for the stock gets a bit tricky.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 2 Comments
  • TECK

    Teck Resources (TCK -2.2%) is downgraded at Canaccord Genuity after the firm cut its coking coal...

    Teck Resources (TCK -2.2%) is downgraded at Canaccord Genuity after the firm cut its coking coal price and volume forecasts for the miner due to weak market conditions. The firm cuts its Q4 benchmark price to $170/metric ton from $220, and “if spot prices remain at current levels or slip further, the Q1 2013 benchmark settlement is likely to also move lower."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 1 Comment

  • Patriot Coal (PCXCQ.PK -6.4%) says it's temporarily suspending about 85K tons of steelmaking...

    Patriot Coal (PCXCQ.PK -6.4%) says it's temporarily suspending about 85K tons of steelmaking coal production per month, citing a continued deterioration in market demand. The production cuts will occur at three Southern West Virginia mine complexes over the next 60 days.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • REGI

    Shares of Renewable Energy (REGI +23.7%) and some other clear energy names surge after the EPA...

    Shares of Renewable Energy (REGI +23.7%) and some other clear energy names surge after the EPA sets the 2013 volume of bio-diesel products required to be included in diesel fuel markets at 1.28B gallons. SCEI +7.5%, AMRS +4.6%, SYNM +3.8%, GEVO +1.8%, PEIX +1.8%, BIOF +1.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 2 Comments

  • Restructuring plans are all the rage with solar manufacturers. Suntech (STP +6.9%), whose...

    Restructuring plans are all the rage with solar manufacturers. Suntech (STP +6.9%), whose survival has been threatened by a $662M fraud, is bouncing after announcing it will slash solar cell and module production capacity as part of an effort to lower costs by 20% in 2012. 1,500 employees affected by the move will either be laid off or offered positions at other facilities. Trina Solar announced a restructuring last week.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM

  • Shares of OpenTable (OPEN -5.4%) slump after Piper Jaffray downgrades the name to Neutral from...

    Shares of OpenTable (OPEN -5.4%) slump after Piper Jaffray downgrades the name to Neutral from Overweight. The outlook for upside earnings surprises for the company is getting a bit cloudier with its iPhone 5 visibility now a known quantity.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • LPRI

    Lone Pine Resources (LPR +2.9%) says it hired RBC Capital Markets to review its asset portfolio...

    Lone Pine Resources (LPR +2.9%) says it hired RBC Capital Markets to review its asset portfolio and identify options to reduce debt, improve liquidity and boost the value of its assets. LPR also hires Scotia Waterous to market certain of its non-core assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM

  • Groupon (GRPN -4.9%) slumps towards $5 again after being added to Evercore's Conviction Sell...

    Groupon (GRPN -4.9%) slumps towards $5 again after being added to Evercore's Conviction Sell list. Evercore analyst Ken Sena downgraded Groupon to Sell on Aug. 17, and has made his feelings about the company's cash flow situation quite clear.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • AKS

    J.P. Morgan downgrades (I, II, III, IV) AK Steel (AKS -5.8%), U.S. Steel (X -4.4%), Reliance...

    J.P. Morgan downgrades (I, II, III, IV) AK Steel (AKS -5.8%), U.S. Steel (X -4.4%), Reliance Steel (RS -3.4%) and Metals USA (MUSA -5%), saying it doesn’t think steel fundamentals will support a continued move higher beyond recent short covering after China’s infrastructure spending news and the latest QE round in the U.S., and that it expects steel prices to decline soon. Also cut: CLF -4.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM | 2 Comments
  • IRIS

    Premarket gainers: IRIS +45%. GNOM +15%. ODP +10%. KTOS +9%. CPRX +9%. TSLA +8%. DVAX +7%. CTIC...

    Premarket gainers: IRIS +45%. GNOM +15%. ODP +10%. KTOS +9%. CPRX +9%. TSLA +8%. DVAX +7%. CTIC +6%.
    Losers: THLD -23%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • MTEM

    Threshold Pharma (THLD) -24.2% premarket after disclosing its recent Phase 2b clinical...

    Threshold Pharma (THLD) -24.2% premarket after disclosing its recent Phase 2b clinical trial of the investigational hypoxia-targeted drug TH-302 in combination with Gemcitabine boosted the survival of pancreatic patients but only by 4.5% - not enough to be statistically significant.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM | 5 Comments
  • TSLA

    With rave reviews already in for the Model S, the name of the game with Tesla Motors...

    With rave reviews already in for the Model S, the name of the game with Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) is its ability to meet production targets. On that note, Elon Musk tips off that the company produced 100 vehicle bodies in a week for the first time in its history. TSLA +8.0% premarket. (Earlier: Morgan Stanley lifts Tesla 2 notches to Overweight)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM | 1 Comment
  • TSLA

    Morgan Stanley lifts Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) two notches to Overweight after having the...

    Morgan Stanley lifts Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) two notches to Overweight after having the electric vehicle maker slotted at Underweight. The key part of the comments out from the investment firm is that it thinks fears that Tesla is having a manufacturing slowdown are "overdone." TSLA +7.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM | 8 Comments
  • JCI

    Along with its guidance updates, Tyco (TYC) says it's gotten approval to break into three by...

    Along with its guidance updates, Tyco (TYC) says it's gotten approval to break into three by spinning off its ADT residential security line and its flow-control business from its fire and security business. The flow-control business is merging with Pentair but will still be majority-owned by Tyco holders. TYC -3.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • ODP

    After leaking out a bit earlier, it's now official that Starboard Value LP is the largest...

    After leaking out a bit earlier, it's now official that Starboard Value LP is the largest shareholder in Office Depot (NYSE:ODP) with a new 13.3% stake. In its letter to management, Starboard stresses that the company should downsize to smaller store formats to drive higher operating margins. Shares of ODP +11.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • LDK

    LDK Solar (NYSE:LDK): Q2 EPS of -$2.00 misses by $0.57. Revenue of $235.4M misses by $2M. Shares...

    LDK Solar (NYSE:LDK): Q2 EPS of -$2.00 misses by $0.57. Revenue of $235.4M misses by $2M. Shares -6.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:03 AM
